ground_truth: She goes back into the room and begins taking things up, flinging down men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear. Fergus looks to the man down in the street, a parody of rejection with his things in his arms. Dil grabs a large goldfish bowl and flings it down, which breaks to bits on the pavement, and goldfish thrash around in the street. Upstairs, Dil closes the window shut. Fergus stands as Dil hands him a glass, and he walks past the photograph and sits down. He looks from her to the picture, nods toward it, and she looks down into her drink. They fall into one another's arms, and she stretches up with her whole body over him as they grow suddenly and violently passionate, with the photograph above them seeming to smile. He draws up her dress with his hands, but she suddenly pulls away, comes up toward him once more, opens the buttons on his shirt, and her mouth travels down his chest. Fergus tries to draw her up toward him, but her hand reaches up to his mouth and presses his head back while her other hand undoes his pants, kisses his stomach, and her mouth moves down his body. Fergus stares at the picture of Jody, whose eyes seem to burn through him. Dil raises her head and kisses his mouth, with tears in his eyes. She sits in front of the mirror, and Fergus gets up, stands behind her, and gently pushes the hair from her face. She embraces him, sits back down in front of the mirror, and Fergus leaves as she reapplies her lipstick. A singer in a blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus are by the bar, both drinking drinks with umbrellas. Dave comes up behind them with his neck brace, stands, and steps two feet back, while Fergus takes Dil's arm. The woman is singing, Dil holds her cheek close to his, looks at him out of the corner of her eye, draws back, looks at him, and dances closer. In the bar, people sing along with the music as Col sings, and Dave sits at the bar sulking. She puts her cheek against his, and Dave slams his drink down, stands up to leave, and on the stage, the act finishes. Dil draws Fergus back to the bar, Col, the barman, pours her drink, and Col pours and smiles. He drinks, grimaces, she throws it back in one, takes the bottle herself, fills their glasses, slams it back, and he sips as she tilts his glass back, and he swallows it in one. She enters; Fergus walks in slowly, and he looks from the cricket whites that are hanging up behind a curtain to the photographs.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She returns back into the chamber and commences retrieving items up, hurling down men's garments, leather pants, a valise, and a teddy bear. Fergus glances to the man down in the road, a caricature of dismissal with his belongings in his arms. Dil seizes a sizable goldfish bowl and hurls it down, which shatters to fragments on the sidewalk, and goldfish thrash about in the street. Upstairs, Dil draws the window shut. Fergus stands as Dil passes him a tumbler, and he strides past the photograph and seats himself. He gazes from her to the illustration, nods toward it, and she glances down into her beverage. They fall into each other's embrace, and she stretches up with her entire body over him as they grow suddenly and violently fervent, with the picture above them seeming to grin. She embraces him, sits back down in front of the mirror, and Fergus departs as she reapplies her lipstick. Dave approaches up behind them with his neck brace, stands, and steps two feet back, while Fergus grips Dil's arm. The lady is singing, Dil holds her cheek close to his, glances at him out of the corner of her eye, draws back, looks at him, and dances closer. In the bar, individuals sing along with the melody as Col sings, and Dave sits at the bar sulking. She puts her cheek against his, and Dave slams his beverage down, rises up to depart, and on the stage, the act concludes. Dil draws Fergus back to the bar, Col, the bartender, pours her beverage, and Col pours and grins. He drinks, grimaces, she throws it back in one, takes the bottle herself, fills their tumblers, slams it back, and he sips as she tilts his tumbler back, and he swallows it in one. She enters; Fergus ambles in slowly, and he gazes from the cricket whites that are hanging up behind a drape to the illustrations.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She returns to the room, tossing men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear. Fergus watches a man in the street, a parody of rejection with his belongings. Dil throws a goldfish bowl, shattering it on the pavement, and goldfish thrash around. She shuts the window. Fergus stands as Dil hands him a glass, and he sits, glancing between her and a photograph. They embrace passionately, the photo above them seeming to smile. He lifts her dress, but she pulls away, opens his shirt, and kisses his chest. Fergus tries to pull her up, but she presses his head back, undoes his pants, kisses his stomach, and moves down his body. Fergus stares at Jody's picture, feeling its gaze. Dil kisses him, tears in his eyes. She sits at the mirror, and Fergus gently moves her hair before leaving as she reapplies lipstick. A singer in a blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus drink at the bar. Dave, in a neck brace, approaches, and Fergus takes Dil's arm. She dances closer, cheek to cheek, as people sing along. Dave slams his drink, stands to leave, and the act ends. Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours drinks. She downs hers, fills their glasses, and they drink together. Fergus enters slowly, observing cricket whites and photographs behind a curtain.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She returns to the room, tossing men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear. Fergus watches a man in the street, holding his belongings. Dil throws a goldfish bowl, shattering it on the pavement, and goldfish flop around. She shuts the window, hands Fergus a glass, and he sits, glancing between her and a photograph. They embrace passionately under the smiling photo. He lifts her dress, but she pulls away, unbuttons his shirt, and kisses his chest. Fergus tries to pull her up, but she presses his head back, undoes his pants, and kisses his stomach. Fergus stares at Jody's picture, feeling its gaze. Dil kisses him, tears in his eyes. She sits at the mirror, and Fergus gently moves her hair before leaving as she reapplies lipstick. A singer in blue performs while Dil and Fergus drink at the bar. Dave, in a neck brace, approaches, and Fergus takes Dil's arm. She dances closer, cheek to cheek, as Dave sulks at the bar. The act ends, and Dil leads Fergus back. Col, the barman, pours drinks, and they drink together. She enters, Fergus follows, observing cricket whites and photographs.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: She returns to the room with a determined stride and begins to pick up various items, energetically tossing aside men's clothing, including leather trousers, a suitcase, and even a teddy bear. Meanwhile, Fergus glances down at the man standing in the street below, who appears to be a comical yet tragic figure of rejection, clutching his belongings awkwardly in his arms. Dil then seizes a large goldfish bowl and hurls it down with force, causing it to shatter into countless pieces on the pavement, while the goldfish inside flop and thrash about helplessly in the street. Upstairs, Dil firmly closes the window, shutting out the scene below. Fergus stands as Dil hands him a glass, and he moves past the photograph, taking a seat. He shifts his gaze from her to the picture, nodding toward it, prompting her to look down into her drink. They embrace each other passionately, with her entire body stretching over him as they become suddenly and intensely passionate, the photograph above them seemingly smiling down on the scene. He begins to lift her dress with his hands, but she abruptly pulls away, only to approach him again, unbuttoning his shirt and letting her mouth travel down his chest. Fergus attempts to draw her back up toward him, but she places her hand on his mouth, gently pushing his head back while her other hand undoes his pants, kissing his stomach as her mouth moves further down his body. Fergus finds himself staring at the picture of Jody, whose eyes seem to pierce through him with intensity. Dil raises her head to kiss his mouth, tears glistening in his eyes. She then sits in front of the mirror, and Fergus rises, standing behind her to gently brush the hair away from her face. She embraces him warmly, then sits back down in front of the mirror as Fergus departs, leaving her to reapply her lipstick. In the bar, a singer dressed in a striking blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus stand by the bar, each holding drinks adorned with little umbrellas. Dave approaches them from behind, wearing his neck brace, and takes a step back, while Fergus takes Dil's arm. The woman continues singing, and Dil presses her cheek close to his, glancing at him from the corner of her eye before drawing back, looking at him, and dancing closer. In the lively bar, patrons sing along with the music as Col performs, and Dave sits at the bar, sulking. She rests her cheek against his, and Dave slams his drink down in frustration, standing up to leave just as the act on stage concludes. Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours her a drink, smiling as he does so. She drinks it down in one swift motion, takes the bottle herself, fills their glasses, and downs it again, while he sips cautiously until she tilts his glass back, prompting him to swallow it all at once. She enters the room, and Fergus follows slowly, his eyes moving from the cricket whites hanging behind a curtain to the photographs displayed around them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a purposeful and resolute stride, she makes her way back into the room, intent on her task. She energetically begins gathering various items, vigorously tossing aside men's clothing items, which include a pair of leather trousers, a suitcase, and even a plush teddy bear. Meanwhile, Fergus shifts his gaze downward to the man standing awkwardly in the street below. This man, clutching his belongings in his arms, cuts a figure that is both comical and tragically pitiful, embodying a sense of rejection. Dil then forcefully grabs a large, shimmering goldfish bowl and throws it down with considerable strength, causing it to shatter into a myriad of tiny pieces on the pavement, while the goldfish inside thrash and flop around helplessly in the street. Upstairs, Dil resolutely shuts the window, effectively shutting out the scene below. Fergus is standing as Dil hands him a glass, and he then moves past the photograph, taking a seat. He shifts his gaze from her, directing it toward the picture, nodding toward it, which prompts her to look down into her drink. They embrace each other passionately, with her entire body stretching over him as they both become suddenly and intensely passionate, while the photograph above them seems to smile down on the unfolding scene. He begins to lift her dress with his hands, but unexpectedly, she pulls away, only to approach him once more, unbuttoning his shirt with a deliberate touch, her mouth sensuously traveling down his chest. Fergus tries to draw her back up toward him, but she gently places her hand on his mouth, softly pushing his head back, while her other hand unfastens his pants, her kisses trailing down his stomach and moving further downward. Fergus finds himself intensely staring at the picture of Jody, whose eyes seem to pierce through him with an undeniable intensity. Dil raises her head to kiss his mouth, tears shimmering in his eyes. She then positions herself in front of the mirror, and Fergus stands behind her, gently brushing the hair away from her face. She embraces him warmly, then sits back down in front of the mirror, allowing Fergus to depart, leaving her alone to reapply her lipstick. In the bar, a captivating singer wearing a striking blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus stand nearby, each holding drinks adorned with decorative little umbrellas. Dave approaches stealthily from behind, still wearing his neck brace, and takes a cautious step back, while Fergus takes Dil's arm. The woman continues singing, and Dil presses her cheek closely against his, casting a sideways glance at him from the corner of her eye before drawing back, looking directly at him, and moving closer in the dance. In the vibrant and lively atmosphere of the bar, patrons jovially sing along with the music as Col performs, while Dave sulks at the bar. She rests her cheek gently against his, and Dave slams down his drink in frustration, standing up to leave just as the act on stage comes to a close. Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours her a drink with a smile. She downs it in one swift motion, takes the bottle herself, replenishes their glasses, and drinks it down once more, while he sips cautiously until she tilts his glass back, prompting him to swallow it all at once. She enters the room with Fergus following slowly behind her, his eyes wandering from the cricket whites hanging behind a curtain to the numerous photographs displayed around them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She reenters the room with a determined stride and begins to gather various items, each one picked up with a swift motion before being flung down with force. Men's clothes scatter across the floor, followed by the heavy thud of leather trousers, the clatter of a suitcase, and the soft landing of a teddy bear. Meanwhile, Fergus shifts his gaze to the man standing down in the street, who appears as a tragic figure of rejection, clutching his belongings awkwardly in his arms. Dil, with a decisive gesture, grabs a large goldfish bowl and hurls it out the window, watching as it shatters into countless pieces on the pavement below, leaving the goldfish to thrash helplessly in the street. Upstairs, she firmly closes the window, sealing off the outside world. Fergus rises to his feet as Dil approaches him, handing him a glass, and he moves past a photograph, taking a seat. His eyes flicker between her and the picture, and he nods toward it, prompting her to lower her gaze into her drink. In a sudden, intense moment, they fall into each other's arms, with her body stretching over him as their passion ignites violently, the photograph above them seeming to smile down on the scene. His hands move to draw up her dress, but she abruptly pulls away, only to approach him again, deftly unbuttoning his shirt as her mouth trails down his chest. Fergus attempts to pull her back up toward him, but she places a hand on his mouth, gently pressing his head back while her other hand skillfully undoes his pants, her lips brushing against his stomach as her mouth continues its journey down his body. Fergus's eyes are drawn to the picture of Jody, whose gaze seems to pierce through him. Dil lifts her head, kisses his mouth, and he feels tears welling in his eyes. She then sits in front of the mirror, and Fergus rises, positioning himself behind her to tenderly push her hair away from her face. She embraces him briefly before sitting back down, and as she begins to reapply her lipstick, Fergus quietly exits the room. Later, a singer in a blue dress captivates the audience while Dil and Fergus stand by the bar, each holding a drink adorned with a small umbrella. Dave approaches from behind, his neck brace visible, and after a moment, he steps back a couple of feet, while Fergus gently takes Dil's arm. The woman continues to sing, and Dil leans her cheek close to his, casting a sidelong glance at him before drawing back, meeting his eyes, and dancing closer. Around them, the bar patrons join in the music, singing along as Col performs, while Dave sits at the bar, sulking. Dil presses her cheek against Fergus's once more, prompting Dave to slam his drink down in frustration, stand up, and leave just as the act on stage concludes. Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours her a drink with a smile. She downs it in one swift motion, takes the bottle herself, refills their glasses, and slams hers back again, while Fergus sips his drink until she tilts his glass back, encouraging him to swallow it all at once. She enters the room, and Fergus follows slowly, his eyes wandering from the cricket whites hanging behind a curtain to the photographs that adorn the space.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She returns to the room, tossing men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear out the window, while Fergus observes the man below collecting his belongings. Dil throws a goldfish bowl, shattering it on the pavement, and then shuts the window. Fergus accepts a glass from Dil, glances at a photograph, and sits down. They embrace passionately beneath the smiling photograph, but she suddenly pulls away, unbuttons his shirt, and kisses down his chest. Fergus tries to draw her back, but she presses his head back, undoes his pants, and kisses his stomach, while he stares at Jody's picture. Dave approaches, steps back, and Fergus takes Dil's arm. As the music plays, Dil dances closer to Fergus, and Dave sulks at the bar. After the performance, Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours drinks. Dil downs her drink, refills their glasses, and encourages Fergus to finish his. She enters a room, and Fergus follows, noticing cricket whites and photographs hanging behind a curtain.

Dave comes up behind them with his neck brace stands and steps two feet back while Fergus takes Dil's arm. The woman is singing. Dil holds her cheek close to his looks at him out of the corner of her eye draws back looks at him and dances closer. In the bar people sing along with the music as Col sings and Dave sits at the bar sulking. She puts her cheek against his and Dave slams his drink down stands up to leave and on the stage the act finishes. Dil draws Fergus back to the bar. Col the barman pours her drink and Col pours and smiles. He drinks grimaces she throws it back in. one takes the bottle herself fills their glasses slams it back and he sips as she tilts his glass back and he swallows it in one. She enters. Fergus walks in slowly and he looks from the cricket whites that are hanging up behind a curtain to the photographs.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She tiptoes into the closet and starts piling objects down, tossing aside women's shoes, denim jackets, a backpack, and a rubber duck. Oliver glances at the child up in the attic, a mirror of acceptance with their toys in a basket. Rory picks up a tiny snow globe and tosses it up, which shatters to pieces on the rooftop, and snowflakes drift along in the attic. Downstairs, Rory swings the door wide. Oliver kneels as Rory offers him a notebook, and he strolls past the painting and stands up. He glances from him to the image, bows towards it, and he gazes down into his book. They tumble onto a pile of pillows, and he stretches down with his entire arm under him as they grow abruptly and silently contemplative, with the painting beside them seeming to weep. He pulls down her scarf with his fingers, but he promptly pushes away, drifts down from him once again, fastens the zippers on her jacket, and his gaze wanders up her sleeve. Oliver attempts to pull her down toward him, but her foot reaches down to his knee and nudges his leg forward while her other foot ties his shoelaces, taps his shoulder, and her eyes glance down his face. Oliver glares at the sculpture of Max, whose mouth seems to whisper to him. Rory lowers his arm and pats his shoulder, with laughter in their eyes. He stands beside the bookshelf, and Oliver rises, strolls beside him, and gently lifts the cap from their head. He spins him, stands up beside the bookshelf, and Oliver vanishes as he closes his notebook. A dancer in a red hat twirls while Rory and Oliver are on the patio, both sipping oranges through straws. Hank emerges next to them with his wristwatch, kneels, and jumps three feet forward, while Oliver takes Rory's hand. The musician is dancing, Rory places his foot close to hers, watches him from the edge of her view, slides forward, glances at him, and skips closer. In the club, people dance along with the rhythm as Ken dances, and Hank lounges at the table smiling. He places his hand against hers, and Hank drops his orange, kneels down to relax, and off the stage, the set concludes. Rory pulls Oliver forward to the patio, Ken, the server, offers her a cocktail, and Ken toasts and winks. He eats, smirks, she gulps it quickly, grabs the pitcher herself, pours their refills, gulps it back, and he nibbles as she angles his plate down, and he devours it quickly. He exits; Oliver strolls out hurriedly, and he glances from the guitar strings that are resting up behind a window to the murals.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dil returns to a room, throwing men's clothes and belongings, including a teddy bear, onto the street in a parody of rejection. She breaks a goldfish bowl, leaving fish thrashing on the pavement below. After closing the window, Dil gives Fergus a drink, and they embrace passionately under the watchful eyes of a photograph. As their intimacy intensifies, Fergus is distracted by the picture of Jody, which seems to haunt him. Dil, with tears, kisses Fergus before sitting at a mirror, reapplying lipstick as Fergus exits. Later, at the bar, they share drinks with umbrellas while a singer in a blue dress performs. Dave, wearing a neck brace, approaches but retreats as Dil and Fergus continue their intimate dance. As the music plays, people sing along, but tension rises when Dave leaves after slamming his drink down. Dil and Fergus return to the bar, where Col, the bartender, serves drinks. She drinks boldly, coaxing Fergus to follow suit. Finally, Fergus enters another room, observing cricket whites and photographs, contemplating his surroundings.
